column4: would anybody be willing to answer a few questions for me about ubuntu / ntfs ?  (I am migrating from windows and have a few questions!)

Well, is ubuntu plug n play?   i just installed ubuntu on 1 hard drive, and want to hook up my windows hard drive as a slave so that i can copy my files over to this ubuntu install.  is that something that would work fairly easily?
what would i have to do in order to mount a slave IDe drive without damaging it?
you can read ntfs, but not write on it *the last time i checked*
you need to mount the ntfs drive to somewhere.
that would be perfect zybrid.  i dont want to have any chance of writing to it
perhaps there is a mount-gui program in reps?
no, its good... if i can mount my ntfs hard disk and read it, then i am set.
i know my way around command line...
can i mount after boot up?  or do i have to edit fstab to make mount during system init.
i think there are some fine howtos at help.ubuntu.org
